name: fluffily
content:
fluffily adverb
(NOT SERIOUSLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is pleasant, but not serious or important: Most of our married friends are amused to hear us talk fluffily about our new relationships. One adviser told me that I should not write "fluffily" about the First Lady's clothes.
More examplesFewer examplesThis looks like a light book - fluffily frivolous with its cute size and its colour photos.He referred to his political opponents as "fluffily compassionate liberals".Seeing his reaction, she became serious and continued less fluffily.

fluffily adverb
(SOFTLY)
in a way that is soft and light like wool or fur: Her hair is long and fluffily layered. Here, your furry friend will get a shampoo, finally emerging fluffily from the dog drier.
in a way that is light and full of air: I enjoyed the fluffily perfect bread rolls. The sky was full of fluffily white clouds.
